business.headline: Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

'A win for India': Piyush Goyal on clinching UK free trade dealUnion Minister Piyush Goyal, speaking at the Business Today India@100 Summit, called the India-UK free trade deal a big win for the country.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

Nitin Gadkari dismisses concerns over ethanol-blended petrol as misinformationUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari firmly defended the government's ethanol-blended petrol initiative, stating that no complaints have surfaced about vehicle issues. Speaking at the India@100 Summit, he challenged critics to cite a single case of malfunction and accused them of spreading baseless misinformation.

Nitin Gadkari's dare on E20 petrol row: Show a single instance of cars facing issueSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Nitin Gadkari said no complaints had been reported so far and accused detractors of spreading misinformation about the government's ethanol-blending programme.

NSDL shares are on a dream run after listing. Should you buy now?The NSDL stock, which made its market debut on August 6, has now risen for three straight sessions—prompting IPO investors to ask: is it time to book profits or hold on?

Want to save tax by claiming HRA for rent paid to parents? Read this firstAccording to tax rules, salaried individuals can claim HRA even if they're living in their parents' home. But the rent must be real, paid regularly, and documented properly.

Government may approve Rs 30,000 crore support to maintain LPG price stabilityThis move is aimed at helping oil marketing companies recover losses they have been facing on domestic LPG sales due to high international prices.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 10:07 am, the Sensex was down 496.21 points at 80,127.05, while the Nifty stood at 24,444.55, lower by 151.60 points.

Retail inflation likely dropped to an eight-year low in July: ReportDespite uneven monsoons, a strong spring harvest has helped India keep a lid on food prices, extending the country's longest disinflationary streak in more than a decade.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as Trump's threat on trade deal spooks Dalal StreetAt the opening bell, the S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points and was trading 310.53 points lower at 80,312.73 around 9:35 am. The broader Nifty50 index also slipped 84.55 points to 24,511.60.

Trump rules out trade talks with India amid tariffs: Will Dalal Street face the heat?With Donald Trump ruling out any negotiations "until it is resolved," Dalal Street could witness a turbulent period as geopolitical tensions spill into the market.

Trump's tariff: What Indian refiners stand to lose if Russian oil stops flowingFor over two years, Indian refiners have been taking advantage of discounted Russian crude. But with the US tightening its stance, that door may soon begin to close.

US targets one-kilo gold bars with new import tariffs: ReportFollowing the US government's announcement last week of a broad 39% tariff on imports from Switzerland, this exacerbates already existing trade tensions between Bern and Washington.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.
Sensex, Nifty end in green as D-Street investors ignore Trump's 50% tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 79.27 points to end at 80,623.26, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 21.95 points to close at 24,596.15.

Why STP and SWP matter more than SIP, explains stock market expertSIPs help you enter the world of investing. But STPs and SWPs help you navigate it wisely, especially when you have a big lump sum to invest or need steady income without eating into your entire savings.

From ally to 'dead economy': Timeline of Trump's tariff turn on IndiaTrump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, bringing the total to 50% on August 6, putting India among the most heavily tariffed nations.

Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

From seafood to auto: How will Trump's 50% tariff impact different sectorsThe tariff hike, set to take effect from August 27, follows a warning issued by Trump earlier over India's continued oil imports from Russia.

Skipped your ITR for years? Here's how it can impact you legally and financiallyIt might feel harmless to skip filing your Income Tax Return once or twice, but if you've been ignoring it for years, you could be heading for serious trouble. From steep penalties to even jail time, here's what you need to know before it's too late.

JSW Cement IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply or skip?Brokerages are mostly positive about JSW Cement IPO, though some advise caution due to the stretched valuation and inconsistent profitability.

Sensex tanks 500 points on 50% Trump's tariff blow: Should Investors worry?The Sensex slipped over 250 points at the open before paring some losses. The Nifty50 was also trading lower, reflecting broad-based caution and expectations of a volatile trading session.

Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump announces additional tariffs; experts advise cautionWhile Sensex opened 250 points lower, it was trading just 131.05 points lower at 80,412.94 at 9:22 am, indicating that the session could see wild swings and high volatility. Nifty50 was also down 67.25 points to 24,506.95.

entertainment.headline: Across genres, through hearts: How British films, shows are finding their momentBritish content has gone from niche to global hit - thanks to its sharp writing, dry humour, and deeply relatable themes. From binge-worthy dramas to clever comedies, the content is striking a chord with viewers globally.

Sidharth Malhotra, Janhvi Kapoor dazzle in ivory-gold at Gaurav Gupta's bridal debutSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor mesmerised at Gaurav Gupta's bridal couture launch on Friday. The duo stunned as showstoppers in regal ivory and gold ensembles.

Sholay@50: RD Burman's Beer Bottles and Whistles Crafted an Iconic ScoreBlending Indian and Western musical elements with ease, RD Burman experimented with unconventional instruments like coconut shells and beer bottles. The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

Vivek Agnihotri reacts to Anurag Kashyap's liar remark: 2-3 people live inside himFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has responded to Anurag Kashyap's allegations, addressing their long-standing professional differences with a mix of criticism and respect. He also backed his past claims about the latter's ''drinking habits''.

Hrithik Roshan's pool workout video has fans gushing over his sculpted bodyHrithik Roshan has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse of his disciplined training regime for his upcoming film 'War 2'. The unfiltered video has got fans gushing over his chiselled body.

Swara Bhasker slams troll over casteist, classist jibe at husband Fahad AhmadActor Swara Bhasker strongly reacted to a troll for his derogatory remarks about her husband Fahad Ahmad. She emphasised the classist nature of the slur in her response.

Sooraj Barjatya on Salman Khan's return as Prem: Script must be age-appropriateDirector Sooraj Barjatya hinted at actor Salman Khan's return as Prem in Rajshri Productions' future project. He opened up on working on an age-appropriate script for Salman.

Udaipur Files released after long legal battle, audience call it mirror to societyUdaipur Files has been released nationwide after legal hurdles. The film highlights societal silence and calls for justice in the Kanhaiyalal murder case.

Fan pays tribute to Rajinikanth with 5,500 posters at temple dedicated to superstarA fan of actor Rajinikanth's celebrated the superstar's 50 years in cinema in a unique way. He decorated a temple with thousands of posters as a tribute to the 'Coolie' actor's legacy.
Here's how BTS fans realised J-Hope, Jimin and V had been drinkingCurrently in Los Angeles, the BTS members enjoyed a day out at an upscale restaurant, though Jungkook and Jin were notably absent.

AI in filmmaking: Innovation or a threat to creative freedom?Artificial Intelligence is shaping the present phase in films. If used transparently, these tools can be a boon that helps in streamlining pre-production, improving accessibility, and even pushing artistic boundaries.

BLACKPINK still in your area: 9 years on, the band reigns supreme in K-pop sceneBLACKPINK celebrates nine years of redefining K-pop with record-breaking achievements. Their upcoming album and continued global tours hint at sustained dominance and evolving artistry.

Malti crashes Nick's rehearsals, Priyanka celebrates early Rakhi in new photo dumpPriyanka Chopra shared a photo dump featuring all the memorable moments of her family. The carousel featured her daughter Malti enjoying her time at beach and crashing into the Jonas Brothers' rehearsal.

Smriti Irani reacts to Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot topping TV, OTT chartsActor-politician Smriti Irani is elated as her show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot is topping the ratings. Irani expressed her gratitude to fans and viewers for their love and support.

Actor Ashish Vidyarthi says he won't return to Bollywood without central rolesVeteran actor Ashish Vidyarthi shares why he's stepped back from films, stating he's waiting for central roles that truly excite him.

Explained: The controversy around Marathi film Khalid Ka ShivajiThe Marathi film 'Khalid Ka Shivaji' has sparked controversy over its portrayal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Right-wing groups claim historical distortion, while the Centre seeks clarification from filmmakers.

Varun Badola backtracks on Saiyaara remark, says his words were misrepresentedActor Varun Badola has clarified that his earlier comments about Saiyaara's promotions were misrepresented. He stated that malicious attempts were being made to tarnish the Mohit Suri directorial.

Jennifer Lopez shops at rival brands after being denied entry at Chanel storeActor Jennifer Lopez was refused entry to a Chanel store in Istanbul due to full capacity. She later shopped at rival luxury brands, highlighting a rare celebrity shopping snub.

Coolie advance booking soars in Kerala, Rajinikanth's film set for massive openingSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' eyes the biggest international opening for a Tamil film. The film's advance bookings in Kerala show a promising momentum at the box office.

general news.headline: 2 soldiers killed in gunfight with terrorists in J&K as Op Akhal enters day 9Two soldiers were killed and four others injured in an overnight gunfight in Kulgam as Operation Akhal continues in south Kashmir.

Delhi deluge: Heavy rain brings capital to a standstill, impacts flightsDelhi-NCR rain: The weekend started on a wet note for Delhi-NCR citizens as heavy rain pounded the national capital, Noida and Gurugram overnight. A red alert has been issued.

A heavy Brics blowback brewing for Trump?Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Brazilian counterpart Lula da Silva called up PM Narendra Modi. The Indian PM is set to visit China soon for the SCO summit. Brics activity has gained momentum amid Trump's tariffs, attacks on the bloc and his cryptocurrency bet against the reported Brics currency.

Used cooking oil to power jet engines, so fry hardIndian Oil's Panipat refinery has been crowned the country's first to pump out sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) from used cooking oil. Your pakoda oil may now get a second life as rocket juice for a 747.

Sholay@50: RD Burman's Beer Bottles and Whistles Crafted an Iconic ScoreBlending Indian and Western musical elements with ease, RD Burman experimented with unconventional instruments like coconut shells and beer bottles. The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

Trump aide calls India 'maharaja of tariffs', backs 50% duty as security measureWhite House trade adviser Peter Navarro defended the additional 25% tariff on India, accusing New Delhi of indirectly funding Moscow's military aggression in Ukraine.

Uddhav Thackeray's last-row seat at Rahul Gandhi dinner meet gets BJP tauntLeading the charge, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said when the undivided Shiv Sena was part of the NDA, Uddhav always sat in the first row.

Delhi passes bill to regulate private school fee hikes, government nod now a mustDelhi has passed a bill requiring all private schools to get government permission before fee hikes, ending decades of unregulated increases and promising more accountability for parents.

Across genres, through hearts: How British films, shows are finding their momentBritish content has gone from niche to global hit - thanks to its sharp writing, dry humour, and deeply relatable themes. From binge-worthy dramas to clever comedies, the content is striking a chord with viewers globally.

DRS: Should Jasprit Bumrah be allowed to pick and choose matches?Jasprit Bumrah is a crucial pillar of India's bowling attack, but allowing him to pick and choose matches could disrupt team balance and increase pressure on other pacers. Data shows that Bumrah has struggled with injuries and workload management, so a structured rest plan is vital rather than an ad-hoc approach. A consistent, well-managed schedule can help maintain his fitness and effectiveness over the long term.

Remarks on wife's cooking, clothing not cruelty: Court cancels case against manThe Bombay High Court ruled that remarks by a husband on wife's attire or cooking do not amount to cruelty under Section 498A IPC and cancelled the case, finding her allegations exaggerated, contradictory, and lacking evidence.

From 'ekla cholo' to handshake: Trinamool-Congress ties thaw ahead of Bengal pollsWith 42 MPs in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha combined, the TMC holds the numbers to sway and stands third on the opposition list with 29 Lok Sabha MPs, after the Congress and the Samajwadi Party.

Ice, rain, rocks and humans: The deadly mix behind Dharali flash floodThe cause of the flash flood that struck Uttarkashi's Dharali village on August 5 is still unclear, though experts have proposed several possible triggers.

No JEE, no CS, failed NEET thrice: IIT Madras student now a data scientistAfter three failed NEET attempts, Sanjay B is now a data scientist at Syngenta, thanks to the IIT Madras BS in Data Science and Applications online degree that doesn't need you to crack JEE.

Hrithik Roshan's pool workout video has fans gushing over his sculpted bodyHrithik Roshan has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse of his disciplined training regime for his upcoming film 'War 2'. The unfiltered video has got fans gushing over his chiselled body.

Trump to meet Putin in Alaska on August 15 for high-stakes Ukraine peace talksDonald Trump says he will host Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska for high-stakes talks on ending the war in Ukraine, calling it a "highly anticipated" step towards peace.

Video: Indian woman shares Rs 8.7 lakh monthly budget for family of 4 in CaliforniaAn Indian woman in the US shares her family's monthly expenses while living in the San Francisco Bay Area. The detailed budget showed the high cost of living and surprised many viewers.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Elderly man from Mumbai loses Rs 9 crore after falling for 'online love' scamThe elderly man befriended a woman on Facebook, who extracted money from him 734 times, totalling an amount of nearly Rs 9 crore.
Palace to polls? Why the BJP is wooing the royaltyFor the BJP, it's about furthering its political cause; for the royals, it's a chance to regain dwindling cultural relevance

Frozen bodies holding guns: When 120 bahadur took on 5,000 Chinese soldiersJust 120 Indian soldiers, led by Major Shaitan Singh Bhati, beat back 5,000 Chinese troopers at Rezang La in 1962, preventing China's takeover of Ladakh. A search party found frozen bodies of Indian soldiers still holding guns, showing the last stand in which 110 of the 120 Indians were killed. Revisiting the legendary battle of the 1962 Indo-China war, which is the subject of Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur.

Dr Anoop Misra on why Indian mangoes are safe and a healthy option for diabeticsTwo Indian studies show certain mango varieties help manage blood sugar in type 2 diabetes. Experts advise controlled intake as a substitute for carbohydrates to gain metabolic benefits.

Caught on CCTV: 2 Punjab Police officers attack journalist on road, suspendedTwo Punjab Police sub-inspectors were suspended on charges of assaulting a freelance journalist publicly in Batala. The incident occurred on August 1 and the footage went viral on social media.

Trump warns of '1929-style Depression' if court rules against his tariffs In a lengthy post on Truth Social, Donald Trump said tariffs were having a "huge positive impact" on the US economy, with "new records set almost every day."

Janhvi Kapoor to Dulquer Salmaan: Celebs glam up for Gaurav Gupta's bridal coutureFrom Janhvi Kapoor to Dulquer Salmaan, several celebrities attended Gaurav Gupta's debut Bridal Couture collection showcase in Mumbai.

Sidharth Malhotra, Janhvi Kapoor dazzle in ivory-gold at Gaurav Gupta's bridal debutSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor mesmerised at Gaurav Gupta's bridal couture launch on Friday. The duo stunned as showstoppers in regal ivory and gold ensembles.

The result wasn't just a film score. It was music that helped turn Sholay into a cinematic legend.

He also backed his past claims about the latter's ''drinking habits''.

sports.headline: It's your debut, finish it: Hasan Nawaz on captain Rizwan's message after 1st ODI winPakistan's match-winner, Hasan Nawaz, revealed the message he got from captain Mohammad Rizwan after his stunning knock in the first ODI against West Indies on Friday, August 8. Nawaz guided his side home as Pakistan secured a five-wicket win in the end.

Ter Stegen back as Barcelona captain after medical clearance rowBarcelona have reinstated Marc-André ter Stegen as captain after resolving a dispute over medical clearance, ending a dramatic 24-hour standoff that began when he refused to share his surgery details with La Liga.

WI vs PAK: Hasan Nawaz stars as Pakistan win 1st ODI by 5 wicketsHasan Nawaz hit an unbeaten 63 on debut as Pakistan beat West Indies by 5 wickets in the 1st ODI 2025, taking an early lead in the three-match series on Friday, August 8.

Paula Badosa forced to withdraw from US Open as injury woes continuePaula Badosa's injury woes continued as she was forced to withdraw from the US Open on Friday, August 8. Badosa was last seen in action in Wimbledon this year.

Theatre of dreams, stage for stars: Manchester United's allure explainedManchester United may have finished 15th last season, but the badge still holds weight. For top players, Old Trafford offers something money can't buy — the chance to write the next great chapter in the Theatre of Dreams.

DRS: Should Jasprit Bumrah be allowed to pick and choose matches?Jasprit Bumrah is a crucial pillar of India's bowling attack, but allowing him to pick and choose matches could disrupt team balance and increase pressure on other pacers. Data shows that Bumrah has struggled with injuries and workload management, so a structured rest plan is vital rather than an ad-hoc approach. A consistent, well-managed schedule can help maintain his fitness and effectiveness over the long term.

Nat Sciver-Brunt scripts history, becomes first-ever batter with 1000 runsThe Hundred: England skipper Nat Sciver-Brunt scripted history after becoming the first-ever player to reach the 1000-run landmark. She achieved the landmark in the match against Birmingham Phoenix at Edgbaston in Birmingham.

Conway, Nicholls and Ravindra centuries push New Zealand's lead to 476ZIM vs NZ: New Zealand extend their lead with yet another dominant batting display as the likes of Devon Conway, Rachin Ravindra and Henry Nicholls rack up their respective centuries to put them well in front.

Chris Woakes makes honest admission after batting with a dislocated shoulderEngland vs India: Chris Woakes opened up about entering the field wielding his bat with just one hand in an extraordinary display of courage at The Oval this week.

Data shows that Bumrah has struggled with injuries and workload management, so a structured rest plan is vital rather than an ad-hoc approach. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
